stories.name: Aditya Dwi Nugroho
stories.title: Starting This Project
stories.story: I created this project to help people practice their first contributions during Hacktoberfest. I wanted to make something simple where anyone could participate, regardless of their coding skills.

stories.name: Karan R
stories.title: My Open Source Journey
stories.story: I am pretty new to contributing to open source, but have been a fan of open source software forever. The idea that a group of people can collectively create products that are sometimes close to or even better than mega corporations is what surprised me. This motivated me to learn how to contribute to open source and here I am, trying to slowly learn various aspects of contributing.

stories.name: Example Contributor
stories.title: My First Open Source Contribution
stories.story: This was my first time contributing to open source! I was nervous at first, but the process was really simple. I just added my story to the JSON file and created a pull request. The maintainer was super helpful and merged it quickly. Now I feel confident to contribute to more projects!

stories.name: Ayush Singh
stories.title: My Open Source Journey Started with Curiosity
stories.story: I got interested in open source through programs like GSoC and Code4GovTech. However, due to a lack of experience at the time, I decided to start exploring GitHub and contributing on my own. My first real contribution was to the Medic organization, which is a part of Code4GovTech. After that, I contributed to WPRig and several other projects. These early steps helped me understand how open source works, and I’ve been learning ever since. It’s been a rewarding journey of growth, and I encourage beginners to start small and stay consistent.

stories.name: HiddenKeyDev
stories.title: My First Contribution After Months of Tutorial Hell
stories.story: I've been learning React for about six months now. Mostly following tutorials on YouTube, building the same to-do apps and weather apps everyone builds, then abandoning them halfway through. My GitHub looks pretty empty because honestly, I never thought my code was good enough to push. I'd start projects, get stuck on something, Google it for hours, then just give up and start a new tutorial. Classic tutorial hell. When Hacktoberfest came around, I wanted to participate but every project I looked at seemed way too advanced. Then I found this one. Just adding a story to a JSON file. No complex algorithms, no fancy React components, just... sharing something real. And I still hesitated for three days before actually doing it. I kept thinking 'my story isn't interesting enough' or 'I haven't contributed to anything real yet so what do I even say?' But then I realized that IS my story - the hesitation, the self-doubt, the endless tutorials without actually building anything original. I'm not employed as a developer yet. I'm not even sure I'm good enough to apply for jobs. But I'm here, making my first contribution, even if it's small. Sometimes the hardest part isn't the code - it's believing your participation actually matters. So here it is. My first merged PR. Hopefully the first of many.
